s.text: To qualify for matching funds, campaigns must verify the addresses, phone numbers, signatures, and occupations of all donors--and constructing this paper trail can be costly.
To qualify for matching funds, campaigns must verify the addresses, phone numbers, signatures, and occupations of all donors--and constructing this paper trail can be costly.
To qualify for matching funds, campaigns must verify the addresses, phone numbers, signatures, and occupations of all donors--and constructing this paper trail can be costly.
To qualify for matching funds, campaigns must verify the addresses, phone numbers, signatures, and occupations of all donors--and constructing this paper trail can be costly.

Monster accounting and legal bills like Gore's are so common that the Federal Election Commission allows presidential campaigns to automatically deduct 10 percent of the money they raise against the $33 million spending cap.
